content:
From: "Jens-D. Doll" <jd@cococo.de>
Hello all,

when starting Isabelle several processes are created on a windows
machine (4 times bash, perl, poly etc) and after closing the main
process at least 2 bash processes remain active. Does anyone know how to
kill the remaining processes?

[A hint: they are somehow created wildly, without identifying their
parent process]

Regards,
Jens

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
Can you be more specific about your version of Windows, and the way you
start and stop Isabelle processes?

The problem of managing process hierarchies reliably is a classic one.
For each Isabelle release I make routine sanity checks, especially on
Windows. So from the lack of detail above, I would say it should work
properly in Isabelle2013, but many side conditions apply.

Makarius
